headline: Is Halliburton (HAL) Offering Value After Strong Multi‑Year Share Price Gains?
summary: If you are wondering whether Halliburton is still reasonably priced or starting to look stretched, its recent share performance gives you a useful starting point. The stock last closed at US$33.36, with returns of 1.0% over 7 days, 18.3% over 30 days, 12.7% year to date, 20.6% over 1 year and 111.3% over 5 years, while the 3 year return sits at a 10.8% decline. Recent share price moves sit against a backdrop of ongoing interest in energy services companies, as investors weigh sector specific...

headline: Change in Venezuela Isn’t the Only Reason to Own Oil-Field-Services Stocks
summary: Oil-field-services giants have been among the biggest gainers in the energy universe since Maduro’s capture:  SLB  and  Halliburton’s  shares have appreciated 21% and 13%, respectively, outpacing the 6.8% gain for an ETF tracking large oil-and-gas-sector companies.  This is especially true for Halliburton, whose business depends more heavily on the short-cycle shale producers in the U.S. that are more reactive to oil prices.  Halliburton on its earnings call on Wednesday said that revenue in North America fell 6% in 2025; it expects another high-single-digit percentage decline in 2026.

headline: Asian shares rise, tracking Wall Street gains as Trump backs down on Greenland
summary: Asian shares mostly advanced on Thursday, tracking Wall Street, after U.S. President Donald Trump walked back from imposing tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland and ruled out using military force to take control of the territory.  The easing tensions drove Wall Street optimism.
